input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the samples in the experiment.
input.help_text: You will need to create a design file with information about the samples in your experiment before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with 3 columns, and a header row. Can be a local file path or URL.

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

barcode_input_dir.description: Directory containing pre-demultiplexed barcode subdirectories (alternative to samplesheet input)
barcode_input_dir.help_text: Provide a directory path containing barcode subdirectories (e.g., barcode01/, barcode02/, unclassified/). The pipeline will automatically discover and process all barcode directories. Mutually exclusive with --input parameter.

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

multiqc_title.description: MultiQC report title. Printed as page header, used for filename if not otherwise specified.

reference_genome_options.title: Reference genome options
reference_genome_options.description: Reference genome related files and options required for the workflow.

genome.help_text:
If using a reference genome configured in the pipeline using iGenomes, use this parameter to give the ID for the reference. This is then used to build the full paths for all required reference genome files e.g. `--genome GRCh38`. 

See the [nf-core website docs](https://nf-co.re/usage/reference_genomes) for more details.

fasta.help_text: This parameter is *mandatory* if `--genome` is not specified. If you don't have a BWA index available this will be generated for you automatically. Combine with `--save_reference` to save BWA index for future runs.

igenomes_ignore.description: Do not load the iGenomes reference config.
igenomes_ignore.help_text: Do not load `igenomes.config` when running the pipeline. You may choose this option if you observe clashes between custom parameters and those supplied in `igenomes.config`.

igenomes_base.description: The base path to the igenomes reference files

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

help_full.description: Display full help text with all parameters.

show_hidden.description: Show hidden parameters in help text.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

max_multiqc_email_size.description: File size limit when attaching MultiQC reports to summary emails.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

hook_url.description: Incoming hook URL for messaging service
hook_url.help_text: Incoming hook URL for messaging service. Currently, MS Teams and Slack are supported.

multiqc_config.description: Custom config file to supply to MultiQC.

multiqc_logo.description: Custom logo file to supply to MultiQC. File name must also be set in the MultiQC config file

multiqc_methods_description.description: Custom MultiQC yaml file containing HTML including a methods description.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

pipelines_testdata_base_path.description: Base URL or local path to location of pipeline test dataset files

trace_report_suffix.description: Suffix to add to the trace report filename. Dynamically generated as date and time in the format yyyy-MM-dd_HH-mm-ss. Set in nextflow.config.

realtime_processing_options.title: Real-time processing options
realtime_processing_options.description: Parameters for real-time sequencing run monitoring and processing.
realtime_processing_options.help_text: Enable real-time monitoring of sequencing output directories. The pipeline will continuously watch for new files and process them as they become available during an active sequencing run.

realtime_mode.description: Enable real-time file monitoring and processing during sequencing runs.
realtime_mode.help_text: When enabled, the pipeline will monitor specified directories for new files and process them incrementally as they are created during an active sequencing run.

nanopore_output_dir.description: Directory to monitor for new FASTQ files in real-time mode.
nanopore_output_dir.help_text: Specify the output directory from your Oxford Nanopore sequencing instrument. The pipeline will watch this location for new FASTQ files.

file_pattern.description: Glob pattern for files to monitor in real-time mode.
file_pattern.help_text: Glob pattern to match files in the watched directory. Default matches FASTQ files (compressed or uncompressed) in the root directory. Use '**/*.fastq{,.gz}' for subdirectories only.

batch_size.description: Number of files to process in each batch.

batch_interval.description: Time interval between batch processing cycles (legacy parameter).

max_files.description: Maximum number of files to process in real-time mode (limits watchPath file detection).
max_files.help_text: Set a limit on the total number of files to process. Useful for testing real-time workflows without processing an entire sequencing run.

watch_directories.description: List of directories to monitor for real-time processing (supports multiple).

priority_samples.description: Comma-separated list of high-priority sample IDs for expedited processing.
priority_samples.help_text: Specify sample IDs as a comma-separated string (e.g., 'sample1,sample2,sample3'). These samples will be processed before others in real-time mode.

enable_realtime_stats.description: Enable snapshot and cumulative statistics generation for real-time monitoring.

realtime_report_interval.description: Report refresh interval in milliseconds for real-time dashboard.

adaptive_batching.description: Enable intelligent batch sizing based on system load and file characteristics.

min_batch_size.description: Minimum number of files per batch for real-time processing.

max_batch_size.description: Maximum number of files per batch for real-time processing.

batch_size_factor.description: Multiplier for dynamic batch sizing calculations.

min_files_per_second.description: Alert threshold for minimum processing speed (files per second).

max_avg_file_age_minutes.description: Alert threshold for maximum average file age (minutes).

min_compression_ratio.description: Alert threshold for minimum compression ratio (data quality indicator).

realtime_timeout_minutes.description: Stop real-time monitoring after N minutes of inactivity (null = run indefinitely).
realtime_timeout_minutes.help_text: Automatically stop the pipeline if no new files are detected for this duration. Useful for unattended sequencing runs.

realtime_processing_grace_period.description: Additional minutes to wait for downstream processing after file detection timeout.
realtime_processing_grace_period.help_text: Grace period after realtime_timeout_minutes expires to allow downstream processes to complete.

dorado_basecalling_options.title: Dorado basecalling options
dorado_basecalling_options.description: Parameters for Oxford Nanopore Technologies POD5 basecalling using Dorado.
dorado_basecalling_options.help_text: Dorado is ONT's official basecaller for converting raw POD5 signal data to FASTQ sequences. These parameters control basecalling and demultiplexing behavior.

use_dorado.description: Enable Dorado basecalling from POD5 files.
use_dorado.help_text: Enable this when starting from raw POD5 files instead of pre-basecalled FASTQ files.

dorado_path.help_text: Path to dorado binary. Defaults to 'dorado' (searches in PATH). Specify full path for custom installations.

dorado_model.help_text: Basecalling model (e.g., 'dna_r10.4.1_e4.3_400bps_hac'). Use simplified syntax without @version suffix for Dorado 1.1+. Common models: hac (high accuracy), sup (super accuracy), fast (speed optimized).

dorado_device.help_text: Device selection: 'auto' (automatic detection), 'cpu' (CPU-only), 'metal' (Apple Silicon), 'cuda:all' (all CUDA GPUs), or 'cuda:<device_id>' (specific CUDA device).

pod5_input_dir.description: Directory containing POD5 files for basecalling.

barcode_kit.help_text: Barcode kit identifier (e.g., 'SQK-NBD114-24', 'SQK-RBK114-96'). Required when using --demultiplex.

demultiplex.help_text: Enable demultiplexing if your samples are barcoded. Requires --barcode_kit parameter.

min_qscore.help_text: Phred quality score threshold. Reads below this score will be filtered during basecalling.

trim_adapters.description: Trim adapters during basecalling using Dorado's built-in adapter trimming.
trim_adapters.help_text: Recommended by ONT. Uses Dorado's built-in adapter detection and trimming.

quality_control_options.title: Quality control options
quality_control_options.description: Parameters for read quality filtering and QC reporting.
quality_control_options.help_text: Choose between multiple nanopore-optimized QC tools and configure filtering thresholds for read length and quality.

qc_tool.help_text: chopper: nanopore-native Rust-based filtering (7x faster, default), fastp: general-purpose with rich HTML reporting, filtlong: nanopore-optimized length-weighted filtering.

skip_fastp.description: Skip FASTP QC step (legacy parameter for backward compatibility).
skip_fastp.help_text: Legacy parameter. Use --qc_tool parameter instead to select quality control tool.

enable_adapter_trimming.description: Enable nanopore adapter trimming with PORECHOP.
enable_adapter_trimming.help_text: Recommended for filtlong/chopper workflows. Dorado users should use --trim_adapters instead.

enable_qc_benchmark.help_text: Compare performance metrics across QC tools (chopper vs fastp vs filtlong).

chopper_quality.description: Minimum quality score for CHOPPER filtering.

chopper_minlength.description: Minimum read length for CHOPPER filtering.

chopper_maxlength.description: Maximum read length for CHOPPER filtering (null = no limit).

chopper_headcrop.description: Number of bases to trim from read start (CHOPPER).

chopper_tailcrop.description: Number of bases to trim from read end (CHOPPER).

filtlong_min_length.description: Minimum read length for FILTLONG filtering.

filtlong_keep_percent.description: Percentage of best reads to keep with FILTLONG (1-100).

filtlong_target_bases.description: Target number of bases to keep with FILTLONG (0 = no limit).

filtlong_min_mean_q.description: Minimum mean quality score for FILTLONG.

fastp_length_required.description: Minimum read length required for FASTP.

fastp_cut_mean_quality.description: Mean quality threshold for FASTP sliding window.

qc_enable_incremental.description: Enable incremental QC statistics aggregation (PromethION optimization).
qc_enable_incremental.help_text: When enabled with chopper/filtlong, batch-level SeqKit statistics are merged using weighted calculations instead of recomputing the entire dataset. Eliminates redundant computations in real-time mode.

nanoplot_realtime_skip_intermediate.description: Skip NanoPlot visualization for intermediate batches in real-time mode (PromethION optimization).
nanoplot_realtime_skip_intermediate.help_text: Run NanoPlot only every Nth batch (see nanoplot_batch_interval) and on the final batch. Saves 54-81 minutes for 30-batch runs.

nanoplot_batch_interval.description: Run NanoPlot visualization every N batches in real-time mode (PromethION optimization).
nanoplot_batch_interval.help_text: When nanoplot_realtime_skip_intermediate is enabled, NanoPlot runs every N batches plus the final batch. Lower values = more frequent plots. Platform defaults: MinION=5, PromethION-8=7, PromethION=10.

multiqc_realtime_final_only.description: Run MultiQC report generation only at the end of real-time processing (PromethION optimization).
multiqc_realtime_final_only.help_text: Leverages Nextflow .collect() operator to defer MultiQC execution until all batch files are available. Saves 3-9 minutes by avoiding redundant file parsing.

taxonomic_classification_options.title: Taxonomic classification options
taxonomic_classification_options.description: Parameters for metagenomic taxonomic profiling and classification.
taxonomic_classification_options.help_text: Configure Kraken2 taxonomic classification and taxpasta output standardization for metagenomic analysis.

classifier.help_text: Currently supports: kraken2. Future versions may include centrifuge, metaphlan, kaiju.

kraken2_db.help_text: Directory containing Kraken2 database files (hash.k2d, opts.k2d, taxo.k2d). Download from https://benlangmead.github.io/aws-indexes/k2 or build custom databases.

save_output_fastqs.description: Save classified/unclassified FASTQ files from Kraken2.
save_output_fastqs.help_text: Outputs separate FASTQ files for classified and unclassified reads. Useful for downstream analysis of specific taxa.

save_reads_assignment.help_text: Save the complete Kraken2 output file with per-read taxonomic assignments. Large files for high-depth sequencing runs.

enable_taxpasta_standardization.description: Enable taxpasta output standardization for consistent taxonomic profile formats.

taxpasta_format.description: Output format for standardized taxonomic profiles.
taxpasta_format.help_text: TSV and CSV for human-readable tables, arrow/parquet for efficient storage, BIOM for compatibility with microbiome analysis tools.

taxonomy_file.description: Optional taxonomy file for taxpasta standardization.

kraken2_memory_mapping.description: Use memory-mapped database loading (faster, less memory).

kraken2_confidence.help_text: Minimum confidence score for taxonomic assignments. Higher values reduce false positives but may miss low-abundance taxa.

kraken2_minimum_hit_groups.description: Minimum number of hit groups (0=no filter).

kraken2_batch_size.description: Batch size for parallel Kraken2 classification.

kraken2_db_chunking.description: Enable database chunking for large datasets.

kraken2_db_merge_strategy.description: Merge strategy for multiple database results.

kraken2_enable_incremental.description: Enable incremental Kraken2 classification with batch caching (PromethION optimization).
kraken2_enable_incremental.help_text: Cache batch-level .kraken2 outputs and merge at the end instead of re-classifying the growing dataset. Eliminates O(nÂ²) complexity. Saves 30-90 minutes for 30-batch runs.

kraken2_cache_dir.description: Cache directory for incremental Kraken2 outputs (PromethION optimization).
kraken2_cache_dir.help_text: Directory to store batch-level .kraken2 and metadata files when kraken2_enable_incremental is enabled. Defaults to ${outdir}/cache/kraken2.

kraken2_preload_database.description: Preload Kraken2 database to shared memory for multi-sample runs (PromethION optimization).
kraken2_preload_database.help_text: Load database once into shared memory, reducing RAM requirements 24x for parallel sample processing. Automatically enabled with --realtime_mode via memory-mapping.

validation_options.title: Validation options
validation_options.help_text: Optional BLAST validation against reference databases to verify taxonomic assignments or identify specific target organisms.

blast_validation.description: Enable BLAST validation of classified sequences.

validation_taxa.description: Comma-separated list of taxa to validate.
validation_taxa.help_text: Specify taxa names or taxIDs to validate (e.g., 'Bacillus anthracis,Yersinia pestis').

assembly_options.title: Assembly options
assembly_options.help_text: Optional genome assembly from filtered nanopore reads using Flye or Miniasm assemblers.

enable_assembly.description: Enable genome assembly step for long-read nanopore data.

assembler.help_text: flye: polished assemblies with repeat resolution (default), miniasm: fast draft assemblies. Future versions may include canu, raven, shasta.

genome_size.help_text: Used by assemblers like flye and canu for parameter optimization.

sequencing_mode.description: Sequencing technology and data type for flye assembler.
sequencing_mode.help_text: nano-raw: regular ONT reads, nano-hq: ONT Q20+ reads, nano-corr: error-corrected reads.

enhanced_monitoring_options.title: Enhanced monitoring options
enhanced_monitoring_options.description: Advanced monitoring, error handling, and reliability features.
enhanced_monitoring_options.help_text: Experimental features for production-scale real-time processing with enhanced error recovery and monitoring capabilities.

enable_enhanced_monitoring.description: Enable enhanced real-time monitoring with all advanced features.

file_stability_time.description: File stability check time in seconds (file locking detection).

max_file_retries.description: Maximum retry attempts for file processing.

enable_error_handler.description: Enable comprehensive error handling with retry logic.

error_max_retries.description: Maximum retry attempts before dead letter queue.

circuit_breaker_threshold.description: Number of failures to trigger circuit breaker.

circuit_breaker_window.description: Time window for failure counting (seconds, 5 minutes).

dynamic_resource_allocation_options.title: Dynamic resource allocation options
dynamic_resource_allocation_options.help_text: EXPERIMENTAL: Adaptive resource allocation based on input characteristics and system availability. Disabled by default for v1.0 stability.

enable_dynamic_resources.help_text: EXPERIMENTAL - disabled by default for v1.0. When enabled, the pipeline will dynamically adjust CPU, memory, and time allocations based on input characteristics.

optimization_profile.help_text: auto: intelligent detection, high_throughput: maximize speed, balanced: speed/resource tradeoff, resource_conservative: minimize resource usage, gpu_optimized: GPU workloads, realtime_optimized: real-time processing, development_testing: development/testing.

resource_safety_factor.help_text: Multiplier applied to predicted resource requirements to add safety margin. Lower values = more conservative allocation.

max_parallel_jobs.description: Maximum parallel jobs for resource optimization.

reporting_visualization_options.title: Reporting and visualization options
reporting_visualization_options.help_text: Configure MultiQC report generation, custom content, and nanopore-specific visualizations.

enable_multiqc_custom_content.description: Enable nanopore-specific custom content in MultiQC.

enable_krona_plots.help_text: Creates interactive HTML charts for exploring taxonomic composition.

enable_dorado_mqc.description: Include Dorado basecalling statistics in MultiQC.

enable_nanopore_stats_mqc.description: Include comprehensive nanopore statistics in MultiQC.

testing_performance_options.title: Testing and performance options
testing_performance_options.description: Development, testing, and performance benchmarking parameters.
testing_performance_options.help_text: Options for test coverage tracking and performance regression detection during development.
